item.title: Dumb Bike, Dumber Owner ğŸ¤¦â€â™‚ï¸ğŸš²
item.description:
It all started with Patrick â€”
Not a person. A bike.
A junk Chinese gravel bike I bought for 600K from the cursed depths of Shitpee.com (yeah, Shopee â€” but worse).

Before it was Patrick, it was just… tragic.
White frame.
Shitty red decals that looked like knock-off fire graphics.
I thought stickers would save it.
So I went full Jaksel-core: anime, fake brands, nonsense logos.
It looked worse.

But I donâ€™t know whyâ€¦
I loved that damn bike.
Maybe because it didnâ€™t care what it looked like.
It just kept rolling â€” no questions asked.

item.title: How I Found Myself
item.description:
How I Found Myself (And Why It Wasnâ€™t What I Expected)

For as long as I can remember, I thought life was supposed to follow a straight line. You pick a dream when youâ€™re youngâ€”astronaut, architect, rockstar, whateverâ€”and then you chase it down, step by step. Thatâ€™s what weâ€™re told, anyway.

But hereâ€™s what nobody tells you: most of us end up somewhere completely different. We blink, years pass, and suddenly weâ€™re not the people we once imagined.

item.title: Pertama
item.description:
I donâ€™t even know where to start.

Maybe this blog exists out of ego. Maybe itâ€™s just me trying to fix the mess I made with rasastroberiâ€”a blog I once loved, hated, and at one point thought about killing (along with the part of me that made it). Or maybe itâ€™s an attempt to bury alkind_COOLâ€”a name so cringe I still flinch thinking about it.

Anywayâ€¦ Iâ€™m glad you’re here.

This space, agungsukariman.com, is gonna be my place to dump thoughts. Iâ€™ll talk about digital marketing, tech stuff, dead or dying SEO tricks, tools I like, music I listen to, things Iâ€™m building, breaking, or obsessed with. Nothing too formal. Just notes from my head to yours.

item.title: Call Me
item.description:
Got something to say? Whether itâ€™s serious or just for fun, Iâ€™m all ears.
If youâ€™re dealing with a tracking issue on the client side, setting up GA4, wrestling with server-side tagging, or your DataLayer looks like spaghetti ğŸ â€” let me know your stack. Iâ€™ll help. Promise. ğŸ¤

You can email me at agungsukariman@gmai.com
or drop a message through the contact form below.

I usually reply within 1Ã—24 hours â³ â€” unless my Wi-Fi decides to ghost me ğŸ‘».

item.title: Long Story Short
item.description:
The truth is, Agung was never meant to be my name. My mom wanted Agus â€” you know, the classic Indo name, mass-produced like mie instan ğŸœ. But maybe thatâ€™s the problem. Too many Aguses walking around. So my dad came through with Agung. Sounds like some Bali prince or gamelan prodigyâ€¦ but nope. Just me. Not Balinese. Justâ€¦ here.

Sukariman? Thatâ€™s a whole other drama.

SU from Sulastri, my mom â€” the real MVP.
KARIM, from the Karim family, who literally picked baby me up from the hospital when my parents were broke. No grab, no gojek, just pure kindness â¤ï¸
And MAN? Thatâ€™s for Basman, my dad. Or as I like to call itâ€¦ Bestman. Lols.
